data.title: Function description and return value information is missing on Intellisense pop-up.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1-alpha
- OS Version: winodws10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open any folder which contains ts file.
2. Add below code in ts and verify intellisense for getElementById function.

```
init: (s:string,p:string,c:string)=> void = function (startButton,pauseButton, clearButton) {
    document.getElementById(startButton)
}
```

Actual: Getting param info, quick ino but API description and return information is missing.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14726598/340a2e12-07d8-11e6-9204-fb736c9baff7.png)

Expected: Intellisense should display info about return value.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/14726620/597d320c-07d8-11e6-9248-d6c341501ead.png)

data.title: Wonky formatting inside TSX brackets with `)}`
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0
- OS Version: Any

When formatting a TSX document, `<span onClick={this.test()}>` gets formatted as `<span onClick={this.test() }>`.

It appears isolated to `)`, for example `<span onClick={this.test}>` is unaffected, as is every other case I could think of to test.

I would assume this is supposed to not have spaces, or respect the non-empty bracket setting added in 1.0.

data.title: Stopping debugging an extension doesn't close dev host after opening a folder
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a Code extension
2. Debug launch extension
3. If debug opens a new window with a folder already open, close the folder in the host and restart debugging
4. Open a folder in the host
5. Stop debugging in the main window

Actual:
Dev host Code window does not close after pressing stop.

data.title: Getting updates on windows 8 is slow.
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.0.1-alpha
- OS Version: Windows10 and Win8

I installed the latest alpha build from https://vscode-builds.azurewebsites.net/alpha on my windows10 and win8 machine. I observed whenever I install the latest build on windows10 I may get a update pop-up instantly if there is any build updates.

data.title: Sash double clicks to even all editor widths

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
The new "Sash double clicks" feature is awesome, but we need a way to equalize _all_ editor widths by double clicking sashes (currently impossible). I think accordion mode might be more likely than one sash misplaced. There's a palette command we can leverage: even editor widths.

Ideas for how to even all editor widths via sashes:
- Double click a sash, it adjusts. Double click the same sash again, all of them equalize.
- Modifier + double click
- Other ideas? Something people are likely to try when hunting for how to do it.

data.title: Permanently minimized
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0 (both Stable and Insiders)
- OS Version: Windows 7 Pro x64, fully updated, with and without firewall, using ordinary user account as well as admin account. .NET 4.5.2 installed.

After starting Vscode I am unable to bring its window up from taskbar, it is permanently minimized. Vscode starts without any visible errors. Taskbar previews show opened window though. There are several instances (6) of Code.exe in running in Taks Manager with varying amount of ram allocated.

data.title: Show move file to trash keybinding in context menu - resolves #5603
perf - slow caches here and there
data.body:
This glob perf discussion got me thinking about that caching we do and the conclusion is that they are bad. Take the new caches in [glob](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/common/glob.ts#L259), similar cases [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/common/glob.ts#L238) and [here](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/common/strings.ts#L270)

There is two problems, (1) they stop being a cache when their limit is reached and new elements come along, and (2) they are slow because every check for the size iterates over all elements and puts them in an array. For example, the worst case for [`normalizeNFC`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/base/common/strings.ts#L270) is to allocate an array with 10000 elements just to figure out that the cache is useless.

Since we have learnt that unbounded arrays aren't a wise choice, we should use a better caching strategy. Use an array and binarySearch or manually keep track of the length

data.title: "Small perf tweaks" commit 79eda2ea breaks float preference values
data.body:
Hi all,

I prefer the mouse wheel to scroll single lines in VS Code, and happily, there's a separate configuration setting to control this without disturbing my global system settings. When `editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity` is set to its default value of `1`, the mouse wheel on my system scrolls 3 lines, but by setting it to `0.33` - at least, in previous versions of VS Code - I got the desired behavior of single line scrolling.

Unfortunately, the seemingly innocuous "small perf tweaks" commit https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/pull/4752/commits/79eda2eaefa014dc2d79c73fa66bf44c59213e0c from a few weeks ago introduced some regressions, one of which is to truncate float values due to the adding of `|0` after every numerical preference value assignment, including `editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity`.

Please consider fixing this and restoring the previous behavior. Thanks!
- VSCode Version: 1.0.1-insider
- OS Version: Windows 8

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Set, for example, `"editor.mouseWheelScrollSensitivity": 0.33` in user or workspace preferences.
2. Watch your mouse scroll wheel have no effect due to its value being changed to `0`.

data.title: [ruby] auto-close for quotes in ruby not working
data.body:

- OS Version: Windows 7 and 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. open new file, save with .rb extension
2. type a common pattern like a['thing'] (or just ' or ") and there is no auto-closing quote. In large files this causes distracting visual noise as all code below gets quoted and unquoted during typing of a small string.
   note: Writing ruby in English, I almost never use an apostrophe (which would need to be escaped (\') anyway if I did need it.) I do use single and double quotes hundreds of times a day.

data.title: Get rid of platform/selection
data.body: We have `platform/selection/` which defines a few things around selection, like `ISelection` and `StructuredSelection` tho these things are never actually used. I can find a lot of implementation of getSelection because of [this](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/common/composite.ts#L45) but the only use case, caller, is the [history](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/services/history/browser/history.ts#L327) which actually work not with `ISelection` things but the editor selection

data.title: fix Korean(and Chinese, Japanese) IME behavior (#4541)
data.body:
Hello, this PR is for issue #4541 - Korean characters problem
- fix displaying Korean letters twice during composition
- show composition letters between the text not over the text

Doing so, I added ICompositionEvent that has 'data' field. On 'compositionupdate' events, textarea is changed by composition data.

To show composition letters between the text, the visibleRange is calculated every compositionupdate event with composition word. It can be expensive.

I changed the variable shouldEmptyTextArea to be always true because I think textarea should be empty when composition starts but I didn't test with other browsers (How?).

Symptom (VSCode v1.0, type 'dkssudgktpdy')
![animation1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3759882/14712510/60204442-0818-11e6-8619-1bfae520c0ce.gif)

Expected (there are two cursors.. it must be fix either)
![animation2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3759882/14712512/6021ba2a-0818-11e6-8eaa-b5530be103d2.gif)

And When I composite letters between the text, the letters are displayed over the text. But Korean IME doesn't act like that.  (type 'gksrmf')
![animation3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3759882/14712511/6020be68-0818-11e6-8753-643345f8f414.gif)

Expected
![animation4](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3759882/14712513/60223d2e-0818-11e6-8753-fd57da33db7c.gif)

It is confused that Japanese IME usually show composition letters over the text (in the notepad) but when I tested with Microsoft Word, the composition letters are occupied between the text. (type 'sensei')
![animation5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3759882/14712515/6029c1f2-0818-11e6-9bc1-8364dfe631d6.gif)

After change
![animation6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3759882/14712514/60299632-0818-11e6-9f2b-a6ecd01d1ddf.gif)

But It's same as Microsoft Word
![animation7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3759882/14712517/604f38ce-0818-11e6-9699-72b8d58292cb.gif)

data.title: KeybindingService is many services
data.body:
The keybindings service is great but also a monster. It does multiple things and I wonder if we can break it up into the following:
- a service that manages context key and its values
- a service that manages and executes commands
- a service that dispatches a key event to a command execution

data.title: Electron Update
data.body:
- [x] Test Linux  @vsccarl 
- [x] Test Windows  @gregvanl 
- [x] Test OS X @alexandrudima 

Electron has been updated to 0.37.6 from 0.35.6 and that brings updates to Chrome (45 -> 49) and node.js (4.1.1 => 5.10.0).

Do some exploratory testing to see if something suspicious shows up. Focus on
- no data loss (quit, close window, etc. with dirty or untitled)
- native features (dialogs, multi window management, drag and drop)
- starting from command line vs. starting from icon
- quick check: you can debug, pause, restart an extension and hit breakpoints
- quick check: you can debug, pause, restart a simple node.js app
- you can install extensions

data.title: Feature: Working files should reload on refresh
data.body:
Currently only the project tree reloads. But if a file was modified outside vscode the working file is never updated. You have to close the file and re-open.

So working files should have some sort of message that a file has been modified outside vscode, and give the option to reload. But at the very least the functionality to reload the project tree should also reload the working files if they have been modified outside vscode

data.title: Intellisense stops working after adding jsconfig file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

It seems after I have Code generate a jsconfig file, the intellisense for my imported es6 module seems to quit working. 

Initially I have just two files in a folder:
script1.js:

``` js
export const MyVar = {
    a: 5,
    b: "hello"
};
```

script2.js:

``` js
import { MyVar } from "./script1.js";
```

Code gives nice completion while typing in script2.js, telling me MyVar has an a and b property.

I then generate the default jsconfig file. At this point, the code completion for MyVar in script2.js stops working, as well as any other features that require cross-file knowledge (Go to Definition for instance). Code completion also stops working for any npm modules I have installed, imported using es6 module syntax.

Any variables declared in script2.js continue to have intellisense.

Here's the jsonconfig file in case it helps (again, it's just the default):

``` json
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "target": "es6"
    },
    "exclude": [
        "node_modules",
        "bower_components",
        "jspm_packages",
        "tmp",
        "temp"
    ]
}
```

data.title: Ubuntu Visual Studio dnx Run Command
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04

I have created a simple WEB API application using Visual Studio Code on Ubuntu(on my VMWare). I completed all prior steps to install & configure .NET core, VS Code & mono libraries and packages. my `package.json` file contains following parameter as:

`"commands": {
    "web": "Microsoft.AspNet.Server.Kestrel"
}`

when I use 'ctrl+shift+p' to get command pallet, I can get `dnx:Run Command`, however after selecting this, I am not getting `dnx web - (MyApplication)`. When I tried to run same application from terminal using `dnx web`. I am getting proper results of saying :

`Hosting environment: Production
Now listening on: http://localhost:5000
Application started. Press Ctrl+C to shut down.`

Same application, I moved to my windows 7 environment, I am getting everything expected from VS Code. I don't have to run explicitly from command prompt.

Is it the behavior of VS Code on **Ubuntu** Vs **Windows** environment or something is wrong.

data.title: JS syntax highlighting with conditionals
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 0.10.11
- OS Version: Ubuntu 15.10

In JavaScript, the value that follows the colon in a conditional statement is not highlighted. For example, in the following statement, the `null` won't be highlighted.

```
var foo = bar ? true : null;
```

data.title: Request to change jade/pug line comment to //-
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.0.0
- OS Version: OSX 10.11.4

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a jade file
2. Press `cmd+/`

In the language config, a jade line comment is currently defined as `//`:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/editor/standalone-languages/jade.ts#L17

This is certainly valid jade, but it gets compiled to an HTML comment, e.g.

**index.jade**

```
// my comment
```

...becomes

**index.html**

```
<!-- my comment -->
```

I think it would be preferable to choose the true jade comment syntax `//-` as **these are not included in the compiled markup**

I cannot speak for all editors, but Sublime Text uses `//-` when you use `cmd+/`, for example.

If you are happy to allow this change, I will gladly submit a PR for it
